remarks: Define the matrices whose determinants are the minors of a square matrix.  In contrast to the standard definition of minors, a row is replaced by 0's and one 1 instead of deleting the column and row (e.g. definition in [Lang] p. 515).  By this, the determinant of such a matrix is equal to the minor determined in the standard way (as determinant of a submatrix, see ~ df-subma - note that the matrix is transposed compared with the submatrix defined in ~ df-subma , but this does not matter because the determinants are the same, see ~ mdettpos ).  Such matrices are used in the definition of an adjunct of a square matrix, see ~ df-madu .  (Contributed by AV, 27-Dec-2018.)
